module.name: FineCalibrationChecker
module.description: Tool for checking accuracy of joint calibration
module.copypolicy: Released under the terms of the GNU GPL v2.0
module.description-long:
This module is a tool for checking the accuracy of joint calibration. Specifically it aims at reading the raw position of the joint encoder and comparing it with the expected golden position, which is the one that the joint should have when we are sure about its mechanics and calibration, i.e. it ground truth.
In order to use this module, whose final target is to print the needed position data to a csv file and then plot it on a GUI, you need to have the following:
supposed to have the correct setup running and the yarprobotinterface open
fineCalibrationChecker --from config.ini
This will instantiate a module and a thread that will run at a specific period. The core od this thread is running some actiions. Once those are done and the user has got all the data the module can be simply closed. In this moment the thread will stop and the module will close.

param.desc: module's name; all the open ports will be tagged with the prefix /name.
name of the robot to connect to.

list of the remote control board to connect to.
list of the axes names to connect to.

output.description: File in csv format containing the data of the joint encoder position and the expected golden position. Gui showing the data in a table.
